message.content: This question requires knowledge about the role of friction in stopping objects using brakes. When brakes are applied, the friction between the brake pads and the wheels creates a force that slows down and eventually stops the object. Option (A) is incorrect because dogs are not objects that can be stopped using brakes. Option (B) is incorrect because birds do not use brakes. Option (D) is incorrect because car toys do not have functioning brakes. Option (C) is the correct answer because pickups (referring to pickup trucks) are vehicles that can be stopped using brakes.

This question requires knowledge about the basic principles of braking and the role of friction in stopping a moving object. When brakes are applied in a vehicle, the friction between the brake pads and the wheels creates a force that opposes the motion of the wheels, ultimately bringing the vehicle to a stop. Option (C) is the correct answer because pickups are a type of vehicle that can be equipped with brakes. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they do not require brakes to stop.

This question requires basic knowledge about the use of friction and brakes. When brakes are applied to stop a vehicle, friction is created between the brake pads and the rotating wheels, which helps to slow down and eventually stop the vehicle. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they are not related to the use of brakes in vehicles.

This question requires basic knowledge about the use of friction in braking systems. Friction is used to stop pickups using brakes. Brakes in a vehicle create friction between the brake pads and the brake rotors or drums, which slows down and eventually stops the vehicle. Options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they are not related to the use of brakes in vehicles.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the use of brakes and friction. When we apply the brakes in a car, friction is used to slow down and eventually stop the car. Option (A) is incorrect because dogs do not use brakes. Option (B) is incorrect because birds also do not use brakes. Option (D) is incorrect because car toys do not have functioning brakes.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the use of friction and brakes in stopping vehicles. Friction is the force that opposes motion between two surfaces in contact. When a vehicle needs to stop, the brakes apply friction to the rotating wheels, which slows down the vehicle and brings it to a stop. Option (A) is incorrect because friction and brakes are not used to stop dogs. Option (B) is incorrect because birds do not use brakes. Option (D) is incorrect because car toys do not have functioning brakes.

This question requires basic knowledge about the use of brakes and friction. When we apply brakes to stop a vehicle, the friction between the brake pads and the brake discs (or brake drums) generates heat and slows down the rotation of the wheels, eventually bringing the vehicle to a stop. Option (A) and (B) are incorrect because dogs and birds do not typically use brakes. Option (D) is incorrect because car toys do not have functioning brakes. Only pickups (or any other type of vehicle) require the use of brakes to stop.

This question requires basic knowledge about how brakes work. When a vehicle applies the brakes, friction is generated between the brake pads and the rotating wheels, causing the vehicle to slow down and eventually stop. Option (A) is incorrect because dogs are not stopped using brakes. Option (B) is also incorrect as birds do not use brakes. Option (D) is incorrect because car toys do not have working brakes. Only option (C) correctly identifies pickups as vehicles that use brakes to stop.

Only option (C), pickups (referring to trucks), commonly use brakes to stop.

Option (A) is incorrect because dogs are not stopped using brakes. Option (B) is incorrect because birds do not use brakes. This question requires basic knowledge about the role of friction in braking systems. Friction is used to convert the kinetic energy of a moving object into heat energy, which helps to slow down and stop the object. In this case, the question is asking about what friction is used to stop using brakes. Among the given options, (C) pickups are the most relevant as they are a type of vehicle that requires brakes to slow down and stop. Options (A) dogs, (B) birds, and (D) car toys are not relevant to braking systems.
